{{also|Appendix:Variations of "es"}} ==Translingual== ===Symbol=== {{head|mul|symbol}} # {{lb|mul|radio slang}} a synonym for "and" #: {{ux|mul|WX HR COLD '''ES''' RAINY|t=The weather here is cold & rainy.}} ---- ==English== ===Etymology 1=== ====Noun==== {{en-noun|esses}} # {{alternative form of|en|ess|nodot=1}} {{gloss|letter 's'}} ===Etymology 2=== {{suffix|en|e|s}}. ====Noun==== {{head|en|noun form}} # {{plural of|en|e}} =====Usage notes===== {{U:en:plurals of letters}} ===Etymology 3=== ====Verb==== {{head|en|verb|be}} # {{eye dialect of|en|is}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=es|-se|SE|Se.|se|se.}} [[Category:English two-letter words]] ---- ==Afrikaans== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|af|nl|est}}, variant of {{m|nl|eest}}, from {{inh|af|dum|eeste}} (also {{m|dum|este}}). ===Noun=== {{af-noun|esse}} # {{l|en|fireplace}} #: {{syn|af|vuurherd}} ---- ==Alemannic German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|Zurich}} {{IPA|gsw|/…ôs/|/…õs/}} ===Etymology 1=== ====Article==== {{head|gsw|article|g=n}} # {{inflection of|gsw|en||n}}: [[a]]/[[an]] #* '''1978''', {{w|Rolf Lyssy}} & Christa Maerker, ''Die Schweizermacher'' (transcript): #*: Das isch September vor '''eme''' Jar gsi. =====Declension===== {{gsw-decl-pronoun|en|e|es||emene|enere|emene|}} * Short forms of the dative ‚Äì {{m|gsw|eme}}, {{m|gsw|ere}}, {{m|gsw|eme}} ‚Äì are also common. ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|de|gmh|ez|√´ í}}, from {{inh|de|goh|iz|i í}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*it}}. Bradshaw, ''Fuyug grammar sketch'' (2007) ---- ==Galician== ===Verb=== {{gl-verb-form}} # {{inflection of|gl|ser||2|s|pres|indc}} ---- ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|'s}} {{qualifier|chiefly informal or poetic}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/…õs/}} * {{audio|de|De-es.ogg|audio}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|de|gmh|√´z}}, from {{inh|de|goh|iz}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*it}}. Compare {{cog|en|his}}. ====Pronoun==== {{head|de|pronoun|cat2=personal pronouns|g=n}} # [[it]] (referring to things) #: {{ux|de|Wo ist das Buch? '''Es''' liegt auf dem Tisch.|t=Where's the book? '''It'''‚Äôs on the table.}} # [[he]] (with reference to male creatures, people etc. that are grammatically neuter) # [[she]] (with reference to female creatures, people etc. that are grammatically neuter) #* '''1952''', {{w|Marie Luise Kaschnitz}}, ‚ÄòDas Dicke Kind‚Äô: #*: Das Kind sagte nichts und sah mich mit seinen k√ºhlen Augen an. Dann war '''es''' fort. #*:: ''The child said nothing and looked at me with her cold eyes. Then '''she''' was gone.'' # {{lb|de|for impersonal verbs}} [[it]] #: {{ux|de|'''Es''' regnet.|t='''It'''‚Äôs raining.}} =====Usage notes===== * In the colloquial speech of some areas, this pronoun is fully replaced with the demonstrative pronoun {{l|de|das}}, with which it shares the unstressed reduction /s/. This reflects a similar development for {{l|de|sie}}/{{l|de|die}}, but predates it. * In a small and closed set of phrases, ''es'' continues a Middle High German ''es'' which was the genitive of ''ez'': ''Ich bin '''es''' m√ºde'' ‚ÄòI am tired '''of it'''‚Äô. =====Inflection===== {{de-decl-personal pronouns}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|de|Es}} * {{l|de|-'s}} * ''by the German spelling reform of 1996:'' {{l|de|gehts}}, {{l|de|nimms}}, {{l|de|wenns}} ===Etymology 2=== ====Article==== {{head|de|article|g=n}} # {{lb|de|regional|colloquial}} {{alternative form of|de|das}} #: ''Soll ich '''es''' Fenster zumachen?'' #:: Should I close '''the''' window? =====Usage notes===== * The contracted form {{m|de|'s}} is more common, but ''es'' is also frequently heard. ---- ==Guinea-Bissau Creole== ===Etymology=== From {{der|pov|pt|este}}. Cognates with {{cog|kea|es}}. ===Pronoun=== {{head|pov|pronoun}} # [[this]] ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/…ôs, es/}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|hrx|pronoun}} # [[it]] ====Inflection==== {{hrx-decl-personal pronouns}} ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Icelandic== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|is|/…õÀês/}} * {{rhymes|is|…õÀês}} ===Noun=== {{is-noun|n|ess|es}} # {{lb|is|music}} [[E flat]] ====Declension==== {{is-decl-noun-n-s||e|s}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|is|e}} * {{l|is|eses}} * {{l|is|as}} * {{l|is|ces}} * {{l|is|des}} * {{l|is|fes}} * {{l|is|ges}} ---- ==Ido== ===Etymology=== By assimilation with {{io-bor|is|es||essere||es|notext=1}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|io|/Àà…õs/}} ===Verb=== {{io-verb form}} # {{apocopic form of|io|esas}} #: {{ux|io|Me '''es''' hike pro ke lu volis lo.|I '''am''' here because he wanted me here.|inline=1}} ---- ==Indonesian== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|id|nl|ijs}}. ===Noun=== {{id-noun}} # [[ice]] ---- ==Interlingua== ===Verb=== {{head|ia|verb form}} # {{inflection of|ia|esser||pres|indc|nodot=1}}: [[is]], [[are]], [[am]] ---- ==Kabuverdianu== ===Etymology 1=== From {{der|kea|pt|eles}}. ===Pronoun=== {{head|kea|pronoun}} # [[they]] ===Etymology 2=== From {{der|kea|pt|este}}. ===Pronoun=== {{head|kea|pronoun}} # [[this]] ---- ==Latin== ===Etymology 1=== {{rfe|la}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{la-IPA}} ====Noun==== {{la-noun|es|g=f|indecl=y}} # {{non-gloss definition|The name of the letter ''{{l|la|S}}''.}} =====Usage notes===== * Multiple Latin names for the letter {{m|la||S}}, {{m|la||s}} have been suggested. The most common is {{m|la||es}} or a {{l|en|syllabic}} {{m|la||s}}, although there is some evidence which also supports, as names for the letter, {{m|la||sƒì}}, {{m|la||sss}}, {{m|la||…ôs}}, {{m|la||s…ô}}, and even (in the fourth- or fifth-century first Antino√´ papyrus, which gives Greek transliterations of the Latin names of the Roman alphabet‚Äôs letters) {{m|grc|ŒπœÉœÉŒµ}}. =====Coordinate terms===== * {{Latin letter names of the Roman alphabet}} ====References==== * {{R:Gaffiot}} * {{R:M&A}} * Arthur E. Gordon, ''The Letter Names of the Latin Alphabet'' ([[w:University of California Press|University of California Press]], 1973; volume 9 of ''University of California Publications: Classical Studies''), especially pages 30‚Äì31, 42‚Äì44, and 63 ===Etymology 2=== Form of the verb {{m|la|sum||am}}. ====Pronunciation==== * {{la-IPA}} ====Verb==== {{la-verb-form|es}} # {{inflection of|la|sum||2|s|pres|actv|indc}} # {{inflection of|la|sum||2|s|pres|actv|impr}} ====Quotations==== * {{seeCites|la}} ===Etymology 3=== Form of the verb {{m|la|ed≈ç||I eat}}. ====Pronunciation==== * {{la-IPA|ƒìs}} ====Verb==== {{la-verb-form|ƒìs}} # {{inflection of|la|ed≈ç||2|s|pres|actv|indc}} # {{inflection of|la|ed≈ç||2|s|pres|actv|impr}} =====Synonyms===== * {{l|la|edis}} [[Category:la:Letter names of the Roman alphabet]] ---- ==Latvian== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|lv|bat-pro|*e≈æ}}, from {{inh|lv|ine-pro|*e«µ}} (from {{m|ine-pro|*√©«µh‚ÇÇ}}). The non-nominative forms derive from {{cog|ine-pro|-}} dependent stem {{m|ine-pro|*me-}} (the ''a'' instead of ''e'' in the Baltic languages appears to result from Iranian influence): reduplicated {{m|ine-pro|*me-me-}} ‚Üí {{m|ine-pro|*mene}} ‚Üí {{cog|bat-pro|-}} genitive/accusative {{m|ine-bsl-pro|*mane}} ‚Üí {{m|lv|*manen}} (by analogy with other accusatives) ‚Üí {{m|lv|*manens}} (by analogy with other genitives) ‚Üí genitive {{m|lv|manis}}, while {{m|lv|*manen}} ‚Üí accusative {{m|lv|mani}}. Dative {{m|lv|man}} comes from an older {{m|lv|*mani}}. Instrumental variant {{m|lv|manim}} imitates the nominal ''i''-stem paradigm. Cognates include {{cog|lt|a≈°}} (archaic {{m|lt|e≈°}}), {{cog|prg|es}}, {{m|prg|as}}, {{cog|xsv|as}}, {{cog|sla-pro|*(j)az—ä}} ({{cog|cu|–∞–∑—ä}}, {{cog|orv|Íôó–∑—ä}}, {{cog|be|-}}, {{cog|uk|-}}, {{cog|ru|—è}}, {{cog|bg|–∞–∑}}, {{cog|cs|j√°}} (from {{m|cs|jaz}}), {{cog|pl|ja}} (from {{m|pl|jaz}})), {{cog|gem-pro|*ekan}}, {{m|gem-pro|*ek}} ({{cog|got|êåπêå∫}}, {{cog|non|ek}}, {{cog|goh|ih}}, {{cog|de|ich}}, {{cog|ang|ic}}, {{cog|en|I}}), {{cog|hit|uk}}, {{cog|sa|‡§Ö‡§π‡§Æ‡•ç|tr=ah√°m}}, {{cog|ae|ê¨Äê¨∞ê¨Üê¨®}}, {{cog|grc|·ºêŒ≥œé}}, {{cog|la|ego}}, {{cog|os|”ï–∑}}.{{R:lv:LEV}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{lv-IPA|…õs}} {{audio|lv|lv-riga-es.ogg}} ====Pronoun==== {{lv-pronoun|pers|1st|s}} # [[I]]; {{non-gloss definition|first person pronoun, referring to the speaker}} #: {{ux|lv|'''Es''' te dzƒ´voju.|t='''I''' live here.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|lv|Vi≈Ü≈° '''mani''' sastapa ceƒºƒÅ.|t=He met '''me''' on the road.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|lv|AtnƒÅc pie '''manis'''!|t=Come to '''me''' (to my place)!|inline=1}} #: {{ux|lv|NƒÅc ar '''mani''' dejot!|t=Come dance with '''me'''!|inline=1}} #: {{ux|lv|'''Man''' nav laiks.|t='''I''' don't have time. (lit. There is no time '''to me'''.)|inline=1}} =====Usage notes===== The form {{m|lv|mans}} is a possessive pronoun ('my'), while {{m|lv|manis}} is a true genitive form ('of me'). The dative form {{m|lv|manim}} is used only optionally, with prepositions. =====Declension===== {{lv-decl-personal pronoun|es|mani|manis|man|mani|manƒ´|extrag=mans|extrad=manim}} =====Related terms===== * {{l|lv|manƒìjs}} =====See also===== * {{l|lv|vietniekvƒÅrds}} {{list:personal pronouns/lv}} ====Noun==== {{lv-noun|m|-}} # [[I]], [[ego]] {{gloss|the [[essence]] of a [[person]]}} #: {{ux|lv|mans '''es'''|t=my '''I''', my '''ego'''|inline=1}} #: {{ux|lv|RunƒÅtƒÅjs izcƒìla savu '''es'''.|t=The speaker highlighted his '''I''', his '''ego'''.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|lv|Briesmƒ´gi nezinƒÅt nekƒÅ un just tikai sevi, savu '''es'''.|t=It is terrible to know and feel nothing except oneself, one's '''I'''.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|lv|Cilvƒìks var pierƒÅdƒ´t savu vƒìrtƒ´bu, apliecinƒÅt savu ‚Äú'''es'''‚Äù tikai darbƒÅ.|t=A person can prove their worth, testify their ‚Äú'''I'''‚Äù, only in (their) work.|inline=1}} ===Etymology 2=== A cross-linguistically frequent way of naming this sound, and the respective letter. ====Noun==== {{lv-noun|m|-}} #
